                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Monitoring locations were selected based on filling spatial gaps in the existing temperature monitoring network, by selecting a range of stream size and temperature classifications using the Nature Conservancy of Canada’s Freshwater Stream Classifications, and in consultation with local community groups.  The data will be useful for thermal modelling, fish habitat assessment, evaluation of diurnal (i.e. daily) fluctuations, comparison to guidelines for aquatic species, and many other anticipated uses.  Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) provided data logger equipment on long-term loan as well as technical advice on proposed monitoring locations, data logger setup, and deployment techniques.  Atlantic Water Network (AWN) provided coordination and advice to community groups on the data uploading procedure for Atlantic DataStream.  Community groups provided staff and volunteers to deploy and maintain the data loggers, to download the data, and to upload the data to Atlantic DataStream.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-9tm7-md96
notes: Monitoring locations were selected based on filling spatial gaps in the existing temperature monitoring network, by selecting a range of stream size and temperature classifications using the Nature Conservancy of Canada’s Freshwater Stream Classifications, and in consultation with local community groups.  The data will be useful for thermal modelling, fish habitat assessment, evaluation of diurnal (i.e. daily) fluctuations, comparison to guidelines for aquatic species, and many other anticipated uses.  Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) provided data logger equipment on long-term loan as well as technical advice on proposed monitoring locations, data logger setup, and deployment techniques.  Atlantic Water Network (AWN) provided coordination and advice to community groups on the data uploading procedure for Atlantic DataStream.  Community groups provided staff and volunteers to deploy and maintain the data loggers, to download the data, and to upload the data to Atlantic DataStream.

notes_translated.en: Monitoring locations were selected based on filling spatial gaps in the existing temperature monitoring network, by selecting a range of stream size and temperature classifications using the Nature Conservancy of Canada’s Freshwater Stream Classifications, and in consultation with local community groups.  The data will be useful for thermal modelling, fish habitat assessment, evaluation of diurnal (i.e. daily) fluctuations, comparison to guidelines for aquatic species, and many other anticipated uses.  Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) provided data logger equipment on long-term loan as well as technical advice on proposed monitoring locations, data logger setup, and deployment techniques.  Atlantic Water Network (AWN) provided coordination and advice to community groups on the data uploading procedure for Atlantic DataStream.  Community groups provided staff and volunteers to deploy and maintain the data loggers, to download the data, and to upload the data to Atlantic DataStream.
notes_translated.fr: Les sites de surveillance ont été sélectionnés en fonction de la nécessité de combler les lacunes spatiales du réseau de surveillance de la température existant, en sélectionnant une gamme de tailles de cours d'eau et de classifications de température à l'aide des classifications des cours d'eau d'eau douce de Conservation de la nature Canada, et en consultation avec des groupes communautaires locaux. Les données seront utiles pour la modélisation thermique, l'évaluation de l'habitat du poisson, l'évaluation des fluctuations diurnes (c'est-à-dire quotidiennes), la comparaison avec les recommandations pour les espèces aquatiques et de nombreuses autres utilisations prévues. Environnement et Changement climatique Canada (ECCC) a fourni de l'équipement d'enregistrement de données en prêt à long terme ainsi que des conseils techniques sur les sites de surveillance proposés, la configuration des enregistreurs de données et les techniques de déploiement. Atlantic Water Network (AWN) a assuré la coordination et fourni des conseils aux groupes communautaires sur la procédure de téléchargement des données pour Atlantic DataStream. Les groupes communautaires ont fourni du personnel et des bénévoles pour déployer et entretenir les enregistreurs de données, télécharger les données et les charger sur Atlantic DataStream.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Wolastoq (Saint John River) Community-Based Temperature Monitoring Data

title_translated.fr: Données communautaires de surveillance de la température à Wolastoq (fleuve Saint-Jean)

title_translation_method.fr: Title text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate
